10.1001/jamanetworkopen.2020.4669.comments: Paper mentions encoded identifiers but not coded healthcare date. No explicit mention.

10.1097/hjh.0000000000000774.comments: Methods section states that primary outcome (cardiovascular death) was defined by ‘International Statistical Classification of Diseases, 10th Revision’ codes I00–I99.

10.1371/journal.pone.0220638.comments: Observational cohort study with live participants.

10.2215/cjn.01450217.comments: Paper not directly related to HF but does mention ICD-9 codes being used

10.1371/journal.pone.0215967.comments: Not HF related (paper is about Diabetes and acute kidney injury). No mention of coded healthcare data being used.

10.1001/jamainternmed.2016.6374.comments: This is an RCT - not observational study; no mention of coded healthcare data.

10.1001/jama.2019.21402.comments: Hospitalizations for HF were identified from diagnosis codes (ICD-10)

10.1177/2048872620974605.comments: Data are collected in a standardised manner from electronic medical records - but no mention overtly of coded data

10.1002/ejhf.303.comments: This is a secondary analysis of a previous RCT so data from that RCT was used, no mention of coded healthcare data

10.1177/2047487319852809.comments: Individual patient data meta-analysis with no overt mention of coded healthcare data

10.1371/journal.pone.0163461.comments: Any patient records in which the word “heart failure” was used as an ED discharge code in computerized hospital records were initially considered for patient selection.

10.1161/jaha.115.001823.comments: Data on adverse events were abstracted from patients’ medical records based on the diagnosis and treatment discharge codes .

10.1001/jamacardio.2016.0765.comments: The HF hospitalization cases were identified from diagnosis codes

10.1002/ejhf.928.comments: Incident HF was defined as the occurrence of a hospitalization with an ICD-9 discharge code 428 in any position or a death certificate with either an ICD-9 code 428 in any position or an ICD-10 code 150 in any position
